trans-unit.source: How to use Queue storage from Python | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to use Queue storage from Python | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use the Azure Queue service from Python to create and delete queues, and insert, get, and delete messages.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use the Azure Queue service from Python to create and delete queues, and insert, get, and delete messages.

trans-unit.source: How to use Queue storage from Python
trans-unit.target: How to use Queue storage from Python

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This guide shows you how to perform common scenarios using the Azure Queue storage service.
trans-unit.target: This guide shows you how to perform common scenarios using the Azure Queue storage service.

trans-unit.source: The samples are written in Python and use the [Python Azure Storage package][].
trans-unit.target: The samples are written in Python and use the [Python Azure Storage package][].

trans-unit.source: The scenarios covered include **inserting**, **peeking**,
trans-unit.target: The scenarios covered include **inserting**, **peeking**,

trans-unit.source: **getting**, and **deleting** queue messages, as well as **creating and deleting queues**.
trans-unit.target: **getting**, and **deleting** queue messages, as well as **creating and deleting queues**.

trans-unit.source: For more information on queues, refer to the [Next Steps][] section.
trans-unit.target: For more information on queues, refer to the [Next Steps][] section.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you need to install Python or the [Python Azure package][], please see the [Python Installation Guide](../python-how-to-install.md).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you need to install Python or the [Python Azure package][], please see the [Python Installation Guide](../python-how-to-install.md).

trans-unit.source: How To: Create a Queue
trans-unit.target: How To: Create a Queue

trans-unit.source: The **QueueService** object lets you work with queues.
trans-unit.target: The **QueueService** object lets you work with queues.

trans-unit.source: The following code creates a **QueueService** object.
trans-unit.target: The following code creates a **QueueService** object.

trans-unit.source: Add the following near the top of any Python file in which you wish to programmatically access Azure Storage:
trans-unit.target: Add the following near the top of any Python file in which you wish to programmatically access Azure Storage:

trans-unit.source: The following code creates a **QueueService** object using the storage account name and account key.
trans-unit.target: The following code creates a **QueueService** object using the storage account name and account key.

trans-unit.source: Replace 'myaccount' and 'mykey' with the real account and key.
trans-unit.target: Replace 'myaccount' and 'mykey' with the real account and key.

trans-unit.source: How To: Insert a Message into a Queue
trans-unit.target: How To: Insert a Message into a Queue

trans-unit.source: To insert a message into a queue, use the **put\_message** method to
trans-unit.target: To insert a message into a queue, use the **put\_message** method to

trans-unit.source: create a new message and add it to the queue.
trans-unit.target: create a new message and add it to the queue.

trans-unit.source: How To: Peek at the Next Message
trans-unit.target: How To: Peek at the Next Message

trans-unit.source: You can peek at the message in the front of a queue without removing it
trans-unit.target: You can peek at the message in the front of a queue without removing it

trans-unit.source: from the queue by calling the **peek\_messages** method.
trans-unit.target: from the queue by calling the **peek\_messages** method.

trans-unit.source: By default,
trans-unit.target: By default,

trans-unit.source: **peek\_messages** peeks at a single message.
trans-unit.target: **peek\_messages** peeks at a single message.

trans-unit.source: How To: Dequeue the Next Message
trans-unit.target: How To: Dequeue the Next Message

trans-unit.source: Your code removes a message from a queue in two steps.
trans-unit.target: Your code removes a message from a queue in two steps.

trans-unit.source: When you call
trans-unit.target: When you call

trans-unit.source: **get\_messages**, you get the next message in a queue by default.
trans-unit.target: **get\_messages**, you get the next message in a queue by default.

trans-unit.source: A
trans-unit.target: A

trans-unit.source: message returned from **get\_messages** becomes invisible to any other
trans-unit.target: message returned from **get\_messages** becomes invisible to any other

trans-unit.source: code reading messages from this queue.
trans-unit.target: code reading messages from this queue.

trans-unit.source: By default, this message stays
trans-unit.target: By default, this message stays

trans-unit.source: invisible for 30 seconds.
trans-unit.target: invisible for 30 seconds.

trans-unit.source: To finish removing the message from the queue,
trans-unit.target: To finish removing the message from the queue,

trans-unit.source: you must also call **delete\_message**.
trans-unit.target: you must also call **delete\_message**.

trans-unit.source: This two-step process of removing
trans-unit.target: This two-step process of removing

trans-unit.source: a message assures that when your code fails to process a message due to
trans-unit.target: a message assures that when your code fails to process a message due to

trans-unit.source: hardware or software failure, another instance of your code can get the
trans-unit.target: hardware or software failure, another instance of your code can get the

trans-unit.source: same message and try again.
trans-unit.target: same message and try again.

trans-unit.source: Your code calls **delete\_message** right
trans-unit.target: Your code calls **delete\_message** right

trans-unit.source: after the message has been processed.
trans-unit.target: after the message has been processed.

trans-unit.source: How To: Change the Contents of a Queued Message
trans-unit.target: How To: Change the Contents of a Queued Message

trans-unit.source: You can change the contents of a message in-place in the queue.
trans-unit.target: You can change the contents of a message in-place in the queue.

trans-unit.source: If the
trans-unit.target: If the

trans-unit.source: message represents a work task, you could use this feature to update the
trans-unit.target: message represents a work task, you could use this feature to update the

trans-unit.source: status of the work task.
trans-unit.target: status of the work task.

trans-unit.source: The code below uses the **update\_message**
trans-unit.target: The code below uses the **update\_message**

trans-unit.source: method to update a message.
trans-unit.target: method to update a message.

trans-unit.source: How To: Additional Options for Dequeuing Messages
trans-unit.target: How To: Additional Options for Dequeuing Messages

trans-unit.source: There are two ways you can customize message retrieval from a queue.
trans-unit.target: There are two ways you can customize message retrieval from a queue.

trans-unit.source: First, you can get a batch of messages (up to 32).
trans-unit.target: First, you can get a batch of messages (up to 32).

trans-unit.source: Second, you can set a
trans-unit.target: Second, you can set a

trans-unit.source: longer or shorter invisibility timeout, allowing your code more or less
trans-unit.target: longer or shorter invisibility timeout, allowing your code more or less

trans-unit.source: time to fully process each message.
trans-unit.target: time to fully process each message.

trans-unit.source: The following code example uses the
trans-unit.target: The following code example uses the

trans-unit.source: **get\_messages** method to get 16 messages in one call.
trans-unit.target: **get\_messages** method to get 16 messages in one call.

trans-unit.source: Then it processes
trans-unit.target: Then it processes

trans-unit.source: each message using a for loop.
trans-unit.target: each message using a for loop.

trans-unit.source: It also sets the invisibility timeout to
trans-unit.target: It also sets the invisibility timeout to

trans-unit.source: five minutes for each message.
trans-unit.target: five minutes for each message.

trans-unit.source: How To: Get the Queue Length
trans-unit.target: How To: Get the Queue Length

trans-unit.source: You can get an estimate of the number of messages in a queue.
trans-unit.target: You can get an estimate of the number of messages in a queue.

trans-unit.source: The
trans-unit.target: The

trans-unit.source: **get\_queue\_metadata** method asks the queue service to return metadata
trans-unit.target: **get\_queue\_metadata** method asks the queue service to return metadata

trans-unit.source: about the queue, and the **x-ms-approximate-messages-count** should be used as the index into the returned dictionary to find the count.
trans-unit.target: about the queue, and the **x-ms-approximate-messages-count** should be used as the index into the returned dictionary to find the count.

trans-unit.source: The result is only approximate because messages can be added or removed after the
trans-unit.target: The result is only approximate because messages can be added or removed after the

trans-unit.source: queue service responds to your request.
trans-unit.target: queue service responds to your request.

trans-unit.source: How To: Delete a Queue
trans-unit.target: How To: Delete a Queue

trans-unit.source: To delete a queue and all the messages contained in it, call the
trans-unit.target: To delete a queue and all the messages contained in it, call the

trans-unit.source: **delete\_queue** method.
trans-unit.target: **delete\_queue** method.
